body: Somewhat similar to how there's workers grabbing chunks for the cache simultaneously?

@ncw We recently came up with an issue where we tried downloading a large file(700 GB+) from S3 locally and it would time out. Supporting multi thread downloads would be a great feature add. Is it something that is planned soon?

issue.title: support for baidu pan (1 TB free)

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello guys!

### Old post 2018

Baidu used to offer 2TB free cloud storage. I registered lately and it is "just" 1TB now. Nevertheless it's 1 terabyte free cloud space. I wouldn't store my stuff on it unencrypted because it's a chinese provider but with rclone encryption i would love to use it.

I also found a go library for baidu netdisk

https://github.com/suconghou/netdisk

### Update 2021

Maintained BaiduPCS go client (confirmed to work by @ericma15) - https://github.com/qjfoidnh/BaiduPCS-Go

Unfinished backend code for rclone - https://github.com/Cnly/rclone/commits/baidupcs

Important note by @Cnly 

> In a word, the users will be always forced to purchase a premium plan to have an acceptable transfer speed. Not saying that its payment method only targeted Chinese users (Baidu baifubao, Alipay, Wechat Pay), unfriendly for the majority.

### How to use GitHub

* Please use the ðŸ‘ [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body: @ncw Just to follow up, I see it is planned for v1.48? Do we think we will get it done by v1.48? Also if I want to contribute, do you think we can start with support for S3 and then expand to other services or do you think we need to have a generic solution which supports all the providers?

> @ncw Just to follow up, I see it is planned for v1.48? Do we think we will get it done by v1.48?

Possibly!  I'm a bit short of time at the moment though :-(

> Also if I want to contribute, do you think we can start with support for S3 and then expand to other services or do you think we need to have a generic solution which supports all the providers?

All remotes are capable of doing multipart download right now... You can Open an Object with a seek position and a range.

Because rclone uses the same interfaces for everything it is the matching upload interface that is the problem, so some help thinking about that would be great!

What I was imagining was a remote would advertise multipart upload capability.  It would need to say something about
- block size range or limits
- min size

And it would need a number of things in the interface
- GetInfo
- Start
- SendBlock
- Finalise
- Abort

Those would map quite well to the multpart capabilities of remotes.

The first one of these to build would be the one for the local backend, but doing one for the S3 backend would be useful too to show that it is possible.

Can you tell me more about your use case?  Do you want to download single files?  Rclone could have a specialized command for that which would be a lot easier to write.
